ground_truth: Rose swings the ax and hits the cabinet door, missing the first mark by several inches, and then approaches Jack. Rose grips the axe handle with both hands and moves her hands apart. Jack stretches the chain across the pipe and closes his eyes as Rose closes her eyes, swings, and cuts the handcuff chain in half. Jack lifts his hands and smiles, and they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway, but Jack pulls her toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside, passengers paddle two lifeboats away from the Titanic, and in one lifeboat, Molly and Ruth stare at the ship, now tilted forward with its bow nearly submerged. A flare shoots up from the bridge deck and explodes. On the boat deck, passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats, and as Lightoller seats people in the lifeboat, one woman toting luggage tries to climb aboard. Lightoller pulls a sobbing gray-haired woman away from her husband and puts her in the boat. An auburn-haired woman cries and kisses a brown-haired man. Cal turns toward Lovejoy as he approaches. Rose follows Jack, who uses the axe to break through the door and into the corridor. A steward addresses them and follows Jack and Rose, but they glance back, causing the steward to stop in his tracks. Lightoller picks up a woman and places her in a boat as Andrews rushes over. Lightoller gazes out at several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic and motions to waiting passengers while several full lifeboats are lowered to the water. Fabrizio and other passengers pop open the third-class gangway door and peer out along the ship, but two seamen pull the passengers back in and close the door. Tommy and others stand at the locked gate atop the third-class stairwell as two stewards unlock the gate. A woman and several men rush through the open gate, and the stewards push back the men, punching them and hitting them with axe handles. One steward pulls out a small handgun and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the third-class stairs, and atop the stairs, Tommy grips the gate and glares at the armed steward. Tommy glowers, points at the steward, then runs downstairs where Fabrizio rushes over, and Jack hugs him. In the suite, Cal removes the heart of the ocean, along with some cash, from the safe and puts it in his jacket pocket before glancing at Lovejoy, who opens his jacket, revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster. Cal closes the safe, locks it, and walks out. Elsewhere, Jack and the others run along a crowded corridor, and Jack leads them down another corridor, where they pass a mustached man flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Rose swings the axe and strikes the cupboard portal, missing the initial mark by several inches, and then approaches Jack. Rose grips the axe handle with both hands and moves her hands apart. Jack stretches the chain across the tube and shuts his eyes as Rose shuts her eyes, swings, and severs the handcuff chain in two. Jack lifts his hands and smiles, and they move into the hallway. Rose points to the inundated staircase, but Jack pulls her toward the opposite end of the hallway. Outside, travelers paddle two lifeboats away from the Titanic, and in one lifeboat, Molly and Ruth gaze at the vessel, now angled forward with its prow nearly submerged. A projectile shoots up from the bridge deck and detonates. On the boat deck, travelers crowd around the remaining lifeboats, and as Lightoller seats people in the lifeboat, one woman carrying luggage tries to climb aboard. Lightoller pulls a sobbing gray-haired woman away from her spouse and puts her in the boat. A red-haired woman cries and kisses a brown-haired man. Cal turns toward Lovejoy as he approaches. Rose follows Jack, who uses the axe to break through the portal and into the hallway. A steward addresses them and follows Jack and Rose, but they glance back, causing the steward to pause in his tracks. Lightoller picks up a woman and places her in a boat as Andrews rushes over. Lightoller gazes out at several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic and motions to waiting travelers while several full lifeboats are lowered to the ocean. Fabrizio and other travelers pop open the third-class passageway door and peer out along the vessel, but two seamen pull the travelers back in and shut the portal. Tommy and others stand at the locked barrier atop the third-class staircase as two stewards unlock the gate. A woman and several men rush through the open barrier, and the stewards push back the men, punching them and hitting them with axe handles. One steward pulls out a small handgun and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed barrier. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the third-class stairs, and atop the staircase, Tommy grips the gate and glares at the armed steward. Tommy glowers, points at the steward, then runs downstairs where Fabrizio rushes over, and Jack embraces him. In the suite, Cal removes the heart of the ocean, along with some cash, from the safe and puts it in his coat pocket before glancing at Lovejoy, who opens his coat, revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster. Cal shuts the safe, locks it, and walks out. Elsewhere, Jack and the others run along a crowded hallway, and Jack leads them down another corridor, where they pass a mustached man flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The ax is swung by Rose and the cabinet door is hit by her, with the first mark missed by several inches, and then Jack is approached by her. The axe handle is gripped by Rose with both hands and her hands are moved apart. The chain is stretched by Jack across the pipe, and his eyes are closed by him as Rose closes her eyes, swings, and the handcuff chain is cut in half. His hands are lifted by Jack, and he smiles as they move into the corridor. The flooded stairway is pointed to by Rose, but she is pulled by Jack toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside, two lifeboats are paddled away from the Titanic by passengers, and in one lifeboat, Molly and Ruth stare at the ship, now tilted forward with its bow nearly submerged. A flare is shot up from the bridge deck and explodes. On the boat deck, the remaining lifeboats are crowded around by passengers, and as people are seated in the lifeboat by Lightoller, one woman toting luggage tries to climb aboard. A sobbing gray-haired woman is pulled away from her husband by Lightoller and placed in the boat. An auburn-haired woman cries and kisses a brown-haired man. Lovejoy is approached by Cal as he turns toward him. Jack is followed by Rose, who breaks through the door and into the corridor with the axe. A steward addresses them and follows Jack and Rose, but they glance back, causing him to stop in his tracks. A woman is picked up by Lightoller and placed in a boat as Andrews rushes over. Several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic are gazed at by Lightoller, and he motions to waiting passengers while several full lifeboats are lowered to the water. The third-class gangway door is popped open by Fabrizio and other passengers, and they peer out along the ship, but two seamen pull the passengers back in and close the door. The locked gate atop the third-class stairwell is stood at by Tommy and others as two stewards unlock the gate. The open gate is rushed through by a woman and several men, and the men are pushed back by the stewards, who punch them and hit them with axe handles. A small handgun is pulled out by one steward and pointed at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. The bottom of the third-class stairs is reached by Jack and Rose, and atop the stairs, the gate is gripped by Tommy as he glares at the armed steward. Tommy glowers, points at the steward, then runs downstairs where Fabrizio rushes over, and Fabrizio is hugged by Jack. In the suite, the heart of the ocean, along with some cash, is removed from the safe by Cal and put in his jacket pocket before he glances at Lovejoy, who opens his jacket, revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster. The safe is closed by Cal, locked, and he walks out. Elsewhere, a crowded corridor is run along by Jack and the others, and they are led by Jack down another corridor, where a mustached man is passed as he flips through a book and studies a sign on the wall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Rose swings the ax, missing the first mark by several inches, then approaches Jack. She grips the axe with both hands, spreading them apart. Jack stretches the chain across the pipe, closes his eyes as Rose swings, cutting the handcuff chain. Jack smiles, they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway, but Jack pulls her the other way. Outside, passengers paddle lifeboats away from Titanic. In one, Molly and Ruth watch the bow submerge. A flare explodes from the bridge deck. On the boat deck, passengers crowd lifeboats. Lightoller seats people as a woman with luggage tries to board. He pulls a sobbing woman from her husband, placing her in the boat. An auburn-haired woman kisses a brown-haired man. Cal turns to Lovejoy approaching. Rose and Jack break through a door into the corridor. A steward follows them but stops when they glance back. Lightoller places a woman in a boat as Andrews rushes over. He watches partially filled lifeboats move away while full ones lower. Fabrizio and others open the gangway door and peer out before seamen pull them back in, closing the door. Tommy and others stand at a locked gate as stewards unlock it. People rush through, but stewards push back the men, hitting them with axe handles. A steward draws a handgun on the contained crowd. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of third-class stairs; Tommy glares at the armed steward, then runs downstairs. Fabrizio rushes over, and Jack hugs him. In the suite, Cal retrieves the heart of the ocean and cash from the safe, pockets them, and notices Lovejoy’s handgun. Cal locks the safe and leaves. Jack and others run along crowded corridors, passing a man flipping through a book.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Rose swings the ax, misses the first mark, but then successfully cuts Jack's handcuff chain. Jack smiles, and they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway, but Jack leads her away. Outside, two lifeboats paddle away from the Titanic; Molly and Ruth watch the sinking ship. A flare explodes. Passengers crowd lifeboats, and Lightoller handles boarding, pulling a gray-haired woman to the boat. An auburn-haired woman tearfully kisses a man. Cal turns to Lovejoy. Jack and Rose break into another corridor, evade a steward, and continue. Lightoller helps load lifeboats as Andrews arrives. Fabrizio and passengers are pulled back from the gangway, while Tommy and others force through a gate blocked by stewards. A steward aims a handgun. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the stairs, reuniting with Tommy and Fabrizio. In the suite, Cal takes the Heart of the Ocean and cash, noticing Lovejoy's hidden handgun. Cal secures the safe and leaves. Jack leads others through crowded corridors, passing a man reading a sign.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Rose, with determination and urgency, swings the gleaming ax forcefully and strikes the cabinet door. Unfortunately, she misses the intended mark by a few inches. Without wasting a moment, she moves toward Jack with resolve. Gripping the ax handle firmly with both of her hands, Rose adjusts her grip by spreading her hands further apart, readying herself for a more precise swing. Meanwhile, Jack, fully aware of the critical nature of the situation, stretches the chain across the sturdy pipe and, bracing himself, closes his eyes. In unison, Rose closes her eyes too, takes a deep breath, and with a brave swing, cleanly severs the handcuff chain, cutting it in half. Jack lifts his now-freed hands and smiles with relief, and together they quickly proceed into the corridor. As Rose gestures toward the flooded stairway, Jack seizes the moment and guides her to the opposite end of the corridor, where more possibilities of escape await.

Outside the doomed ship, passengers are seen frantically paddling two lifeboats away from the massive, sinking Titanic. In one of the lifeboats, Molly and Ruth stare back at the ship, observing in horror as it tilts forward, with its great bow almost entirely submerged beneath the icy water. Suddenly, a flare brightens the night sky, shooting up from the bridge deck and exploding brilliantly. On the chaotic boat deck, passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats, desperate to secure a place. As Lightoller diligently seats people in a lifeboat, a woman burdened with luggage attempts to climb aboard. With urgency, Lightoller pulls a sobbing gray-haired woman away from her beloved husband and places her in the lifeboat for her own safety. Nearby, an auburn-haired woman cries and passionately kisses a brown-haired man, possibly for the last time. Amidst the chaos, Cal turns to face Lovejoy as he approaches with intent.

Meanwhile, Rose follows closely behind Jack, who uses the ax to break through a sturdy door, leading them both into another corridor. A steward, noticing their swift movement, addresses them and starts to follow. However, as Jack and Rose cast a glance back, the steward hesitates and comes to a halt, uncertain of his next move. Lightoller, with a sense of duty, picks up a woman and gently places her in a lifeboat, just as Andrews rushes over to assist. Lightoller gazes out at the sea, watching several partially filled lifeboats as they drift away from the Titanic, and motions for the remaining passengers to be seated while more fully-laden lifeboats are steadily lowered to the water below.

Deep within the ship, Fabrizio and other passengers pry open the third-class gangway door, peering out anxiously along the vessel's side. In a swift move, two seamen pull the passengers back inside and securely close the door. Upstairs, Tommy and others gather at the locked gate at the top of the third-class stairwell, as two stewards work to unlock it. As the gate swings open, a woman and several men rush through in a panic, but the stewards push back the advancing men, resorting to punches and wielding ax handles to maintain control. In a rapid escalation, one steward brandishes a small handgun and aims it menacingly at the crowd now trapped behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose, intent on making their escape, reach the bottom of the third-class stairs, while at the top, Tommy grips the gate tightly, glaring fiercely at the armed steward. With determination in his eyes, Tommy points accusatorily at the steward before descending the stairs at a run, where Fabrizio joins him, and Jack envelops him in a reassuring hug.

In the opulent suite, Cal methodically removes the precious heart of the ocean, along with a stack of cash, from the heavy safe. He carefully places these treasures into his jacket pocket, casting a glance at Lovejoy, who signals readiness by revealing a handgun nestled in a shoulder holster under his jacket. With finality, Cal closes the safe, securing its contents, and locks it before striding out with purpose. Elsewhere on the ship, Jack and the others navigate through a crowded corridor, with Jack leading them with determination into another less congested passageway, where they pass a mustached man who is deeply engrossed in flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall, oblivious to the unfolding chaos.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Rose, driven by determination and a sense of urgency, swings the gleaming ax with all her might and strikes the cabinet door. However, in an unfortunate turn of events, she misses the intended target by several inches. Without allowing herself the luxury of hesitation, she moves purposefully toward Jack. Gripping the ax handle firmly with both of her hands, she adjusts her hold by spreading her hands further apart, preparing herself for a more precise and controlled swing. Meanwhile, Jack, fully cognizant of the critical nature of their predicament, stretches the chain across the sturdy pipe. Preparing himself mentally and physically, he closes his eyes. In a synchronized moment, Rose also shuts her eyes, inhales deeply, and with a brave, decisive swing, severs the handcuff chain, slicing it cleanly in half. Jack lifts his now-freed hands with noticeable relief and smiles, and together they quickly advance into the corridor. As Rose gestures urgently toward the flooded stairway, Jack seizes the moment and guides her to the opposite end of the corridor, where more potential escape routes await them.

Outside the doomed and rapidly deteriorating ship, passengers are seen frantically paddling two lifeboats away from the massive, sinking Titanic. In one of these lifeboats, Molly and Ruth observe the ship with horror-stricken eyes as it tilts forward, its great bow almost entirely swallowed by the icy water. Suddenly, a flare brightens the night sky, shooting up from the bridge deck and bursting brilliantly against the darkness. On the chaotic boat deck, desperate passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats, anxious to secure a place. As Lightoller diligently seats people into a lifeboat, a woman, heavily burdened with luggage, attempts to climb aboard. Acting with urgency, Lightoller pulls a sobbing gray-haired woman away from her beloved husband, ensuring her safety by placing her in the lifeboat. Nearby, an auburn-haired woman cries passionately and kisses a brown-haired man, possibly for the final time. Amidst this chaos, Cal turns to face Lovejoy, who approaches with determined intent.

Meanwhile, Rose follows closely behind Jack, who uses the ax to forcefully break through a sturdy door, leading them both into another corridor. A steward, noticing their swift, purposeful movement, calls out to them and starts to follow. However, as Jack and Rose glance back, the steward hesitates, coming to a halt, uncertain about his next action. Lightoller, with a strong sense of duty, picks up a woman, gently placing her in a lifeboat just as Andrews rushes over to offer assistance. Lightoller gazes out at the sea, observing several partially filled lifeboats as they drift away from the Titanic, and motions for the remaining passengers to be seated while more fully-laden lifeboats are steadily lowered to the water below.

Deep within the ship's bowels, Fabrizio and other passengers pry open the third-class gangway door, peering anxiously along the vessel's side. In a swift move, two seamen quickly pull the passengers back inside and securely close the door. Upstairs, Tommy and others gather at the locked gate at the top of the third-class stairwell, where two stewards work quickly to unlock it. As the gate swings open, a panicked woman and several men rush through, but the stewards push back the advancing men, resorting to punches and their ax handles to maintain control. In a rapid escalation, one steward brandishes a small handgun, aiming it menacingly at the crowd now trapped behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose, intent on making their escape, reach the bottom of the third-class stairs, while at the top, Tommy grips the gate tightly, glaring fiercely at the armed steward. With determination blazing in his eyes, Tommy points accusingly at the steward before descending the stairs at a run, where Fabrizio joins him, and Jack envelops him in a reassuring and heartfelt hug.

In the opulent and richly adorned suite, Cal methodically removes the precious heart of the ocean and a substantial stack of cash from the heavy, secure safe. He meticulously places these treasures into his jacket pocket and casts a glance at Lovejoy, who signals his readiness by revealing a handgun nestled inside a shoulder holster under his jacket. With a sense of finality, Cal closes the safe, securely locking its contents, and strides out with determined purpose. Elsewhere on the ship, Jack and the others navigate through a crowded corridor. Leading them with determination, Jack guides them into another less congested passageway, where they pass a mustached man who is deeply engrossed in flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall, completely oblivious to the unfolding chaos around him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rose, with a determined yet slightly nervous grip, swings the axe with force, aiming for the cabinet door but missing her first intended mark by several inches. She then approaches Jack, focusing intently as her hands grip the axe handle, sliding them apart to optimize her control and strength for the upcoming crucial swing. Meanwhile, Jack steadies himself, stretching the chain taut across the pipe and mentally preparing for the impact. He closes his eyes in anticipation, trusting Rose completely. With a deep breath, Rose also closes her eyes, visualizing her target before expertly swinging the axe, successfully cutting the handcuff chain in half. As the chain falls away, Jack, filled with relief and gratitude, raises his newly freed hands and can't help but smile. Together, they swiftly transition into the corridor, where Rose instinctively points toward the flooded stairway as a possible escape route. However, Jack, considering a safer option, gently directs her toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside, amidst the chilling night, passengers work together to paddle two lifeboats away from the doomed Titanic. In one lifeboat, Molly and Ruth, wearing expressions of disbelief and sorrow, gaze back at the magnificent ship now ominously tilted forward with its bow disappearing beneath the icy water. Abruptly, a flare launches from the bridge deck, soaring into the sky before dramatically exploding, illuminating the desperate scene below. On the boat deck, a tense crowd of passengers gathers around the few remaining lifeboats, their anxiety palpable. Lightoller, methodical and firm, organizes the seating, ensuring each lifeboat departs with as many people as safely possible. Among the chaos, a determined woman, burdened with luggage, attempts to climb aboard only to be gently but firmly guided by Lightoller. Meanwhile, he compassionately separates a sobbing gray-haired woman from her husband, prioritizing her safety by placing her in the boat. Nearby, an auburn-haired woman, overwrought with emotion, shares a tearful kiss with a brown-haired man, a poignant farewell amid the pandemonium. Cal, driven by his own agenda, turns abruptly just as Lovejoy approaches, drawing his attention away. Meanwhile, Rose, following closely behind Jack, watches as he wields the axe once more, using it to break through a door and gain access to another corridor. A steward, noticing their actions, addresses them, but as Jack and Rose glance back, their confident defiance causes him to hesitate and stop in his tracks. Lightoller, back on the boat deck, lifts another woman firmly yet gently, placing her into a lifeboat as Andrews rushes over, clearly concerned. Lightoller's gaze shifts to the partially filled lifeboats drifting away, and he gestures urgently to the waiting passengers to board the available boats, all while several full lifeboats are painstakingly lowered into the water below. Meanwhile, down below, Fabrizio and a group of third-class passengers pry open the third-class gangway door, peering out with hope along the ship's length, only to be pulled back in by two vigilant seamen who quickly shut the door again. Back at the top of the third-class stairwell, Tommy stands with others, his fingers gripping the locked gate with frustration and determination. As two stewards unlock the gate, a sudden rush ensues as a woman and several men seize the opportunity to dash through the opening, only to be met with the stewards' aggressive attempts to regain control, resorting to punches and blows with axe handles. Tensions escalate when one steward brandishes a small handgun, aiming it menacingly at the crowd now contained behind the re-secured gate. Jack and Rose arrive at the foot of the third-class stairs, only to look up and see Tommy glaring with anger and defiance at the armed steward. He points accusingly then quickly descends the stairs, meeting Fabrizio, who rushes over with urgency, leading to a brief but heartfelt hug from Jack as a silent acknowledgment of their shared struggle. In another part of the ship, Cal, calculating and composed, opens the safe in the suite, extracting the precious heart of the ocean necklace along with a stash of cash, securing them in his jacket pocket. He then glances at Lovejoy, who, with a subtle but unmistakable gesture, reveals a handgun nestled in a shoulder holster. With a final look around, Cal methodically closes and locks the safe before striding out purposefully. Simultaneously, Jack, Rose, and the others navigate through a crowded corridor, urgency driving their every step. Jack takes the lead, guiding them down an alternate corridor, where they pass a mustached man who is seemingly oblivious to the chaos, engrossed in flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Rose swings the axe and, despite missing the first mark, successfully cuts Jack's handcuff chain on her next attempt. Together, they move into the corridor, where Jack leads them away from a flooded stairway. Meanwhile, outside, lifeboats paddle away from the Titanic, with passengers like Molly and Ruth watching the ship's perilous tilt. On the deck, Lightoller oversees the seating of passengers in lifeboats, assisting a sobbing woman and deterring others from overcrowding. Cal converses with Lovejoy as the situation on the ship intensifies. Jack and Rose break into the corridor, with a steward momentarily following before stopping at their glance. Lightoller continues directing passengers, noting the lifeboats drifting away, while below deck, Fabrizio and others open the gangway door only to be pushed back by seamen. In third-class, chaos erupts at the locked stairwell gate until the stewards forcibly manage the crowd. Jack, Rose, and Tommy reunite with Fabrizio at the bottom of the stairs. In a suite, Cal secures valuables from a safe and notices Lovejoy's concealed weapon. Jack and the others navigate through crowded corridors, avoiding obstacles as they follow Jack's lead past distracted passengers.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Rose swings the ax, a tool crucial for emergencies on board, and hits the cabinet door, missing the first mark by several inches, and then approaches Jack. Rose grips the axe handle with both hands and moves her hands apart, a technique taught for better control and force. Jack stretches the chain across the pipe, a method used to increase tension, and closes his eyes as Rose, focusing intently, swings and cuts the handcuff chain in half. Jack lifts his hands and smiles, his relief evident as they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway, a scene common as the Titanic, the doomed British passenger liner on her maiden voyage, took on water, but Jack pulls her toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside, passengers paddle two lifeboats away from the Titanic, with their paddling contrasting the chaos on the sinking ship, and in one lifeboat, Molly Brown, a socialite and philanthropist known for her outspoken nature, and Ruth DeWitt Bukater stare at the ship, now tilted forward with its bow nearly submerged in the frigid Atlantic. A flare, used to signal distress, shoots up from the bridge deck and explodes. On the boat deck, passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats, desperately seeking survival, and as Lightoller, the ship's second officer known for his strict adherence to protocol, seats people in the lifeboat, one woman toting luggage tries to climb aboard. Lightoller pulls a sobbing gray-haired woman away from her husband and puts her in the boat, adhering to the "women and children first" protocol. An auburn-haired woman cries and kisses a brown-haired man, a poignant farewell highlighting the personal tragedies unfolding. Cal, a wealthy steel magnate, turns toward Lovejoy, his valet and confidant, as he approaches. Rose follows Jack, who uses the axe to break through the door and into the corridor, demonstrating urgency as water levels rise. A steward, responsible for passenger safety, addresses them and follows Jack and Rose, but they glance back, causing the steward to stop in his tracks, hesitant as panic spreads. Lightoller, with an air of authority, picks up a woman and places her in a boat as Andrews, the ship's designer haunted by the disaster, rushes over. Lightoller gazes out at several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic and motions to waiting passengers while several full lifeboats are lowered to the water, emphasizing the uneven evacuation efforts. Fabrizio, an Italian immigrant seeking a new life in America, and other passengers pop open the third-class gangway door to peer out along the ship, but two seamen, enforcing order amid the chaos, pull the passengers back in and close the door. Tommy, a spirited Irishman, and others stand at the locked gate atop the third-class stairwell as two stewards unlock the gate, finally allowing some to escape. A woman and several men rush through the open gate, and the stewards push back the men, punching them and hitting them with axe handles in desperation to control the crowd. One steward pulls out a small handgun, a drastic measure, and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the third-class stairs, and atop the stairs, Tommy grips the gate and glares at the armed steward, his anger fueling his defiance. Tommy glowers, points at the steward, then runs downstairs where Fabrizio, relieved yet anxious, rushes over, and Jack hugs him, their friendship enduring even in crisis. In the suite, Cal removes the Heart of the Ocean, an exquisite blue diamond necklace symbolizing wealth and vanity, along with some cash, from the safe and puts it in his jacket pocket before glancing at Lovejoy, who opens his jacket, revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster, prepared for treacherous times. Cal closes the safe, locks it, and walks out, his priorities clear. Elsewhere, Jack and the others run along a crowded corridor, each step urgent as water rises, and Jack leads them down another corridor, where they pass a mustached man, an unlikely scholar amidst chaos, flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall, perhaps searching for direction or merely in denial.

Rose grips the axe handle with both hands and moves her hands apart. Jack stretches the chain across the pipe and closes his eyes. as Rose closes her eyes swings and cuts the handcuff chain in half. Rose follows Jack who uses the axe to break through the door and into the corridor. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. A steward addresses them and follows Jack and Rose but they glance back causing the steward to stop in his tracks. Lightoller picks up a woman and places her in a boat as Andrews rushes over. Lightoller gazes out at several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic and motions to waiting passengers. while several full lifeboats are lowered to the water. Fabrizio and other passengers pop open the thirdclass gangway door and peer out along the ship but two seamen pull the passengers back in and close the door. Tommy and others stand at the locked gate atop the thirdclass stairwell as two stewards unlock the gate. A woman and several men rush through the open gate and the stewards push back the men punching them and hitting them with axe handles. One steward pulls out a small handgun and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the thirdclass stairs and atop the stairs. Tommy grips the gate and glares at the armed steward. Tommy glowers points at the steward then runs downstairs where Fabrizio rushes over and Jack hugs him. In the suite Cal removes the heart of the ocean along with some cash from the safe and puts it in his jacket pocket before glancing at Lovejoy who opens his jacket revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster. Cal closes the safe locks it and walks out. Elsewhere. Jack and the others run along a crowded corridor and Jack leads them down another corridor where they pass a mustached man flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Rose swings the ax and hits the cabinet door missing the first mark by several inches and then approaches Jack. Rose grips the axe handle with both hands and moves her hands apart. Jack stretches the chain across the pipe and closes his eyes. as Rose closes her eyes swings and cuts the handcuff chain in half. Jack lifts his hands and smiles and they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway but Jack pulls her toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside passengers paddle two lifeboats away from the Titanic and in one lifeboat. Molly and Ruth stare at the ship now tilted forward with its bow nearly submerged. A flare shoots up from the bridge deck and explodes. On the boat deck passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats and as Lightoller seats people in the lifeboat one woman toting luggage tries to climb aboard. Lightoller pulls a sobbing grayhaired woman away from her husband and puts her in the boat. An auburnhaired woman cries and kisses a brownhaired man. Cal turns toward Lovejoy as he approaches. Rose follows Jack who uses the axe to break through the door and into the corridor. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. A steward addresses them and follows Jack and Rose but they glance back causing the steward to stop in his tracks. Lightoller picks up a woman and places her in a boat as Andrews rushes over. Lightoller gazes out at several partially filled lifeboats moving away from the Titanic and motions to waiting passengers. while several full lifeboats are lowered to the water. Fabrizio and other passengers pop open the thirdclass gangway door and peer out along the ship but two seamen pull the passengers back in and close the door. Tommy and others stand at the locked gate atop the thirdclass stairwell as two stewards unlock the gate. A woman and several men rush through the open gate and the stewards push back the men punching them and hitting them with axe handles. One steward pulls out a small handgun and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. Jack and Rose reach the bottom of the thirdclass stairs and atop the stairs. Tommy grips the gate and glares at the armed steward. Tommy glowers points at the steward then runs downstairs where Fabrizio rushes over and Jack hugs him. In the suite Cal removes the heart of the ocean along with some cash from the safe and puts it in his jacket pocket before glancing at Lovejoy who opens his jacket revealing a handgun in a shoulder holster. Cal closes the safe locks it and walks out. Elsewhere. Jack and the others run along a crowded corridor and Jack leads them down another corridor where they pass a mustached man flipping through a book and studying a sign on the wall.

Jack lifts his hands and smiles and they move into the corridor. Rose points to the flooded stairway but Jack pulls her toward the opposite end of the corridor. Outside passengers paddle two lifeboats away from the Titanic and in one lifeboat. One steward pulls out a small handgun and points it at the crowd now contained behind the closed gate. test_cases.description: Rose swings the ax and hits the cabinet door missing the first mark by several inches and then approaches Jack. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tulip twirls the spoon and taps the garden fence, skimming the final target by several centimeters, and then strolls toward Finn. Tulip clutches the spoon handle with both knees and pushes her knees apart. Finn pushes the ribbon around the balloon and shuts his ears as Tulip shuts her ears, twirls, and slices the shoelace ribbon in two. Finn raises his ears and grins, and they crawl into the tunnel. Tulip gestures to the frozen ladder, but Finn yanks her toward the opposite side of the tunnel. Inside, tourists row two kayaks away from the bungalow, and in one kayak, Darcy and Lila gaze at the cottage, now leaning eastward with its roof nearly invisible. A pebble leaps up from the highway bridge and implodes. On the church roof, tourists huddle around the spare kayaks, and as Rutherford places creatures in the kayak, one bear carrying a backpack tries to leap aboard. Rutherford drags a laughing golden-haired bear away from her brother and drops her in the kayak. A raven-haired bear hollers and hugs a blond bear. Seth spins toward Felix as he leaps forward. Tulip trails Finn, who wields the spoon to slice through the fence and into the tunnel. A librarian confronts them and shuffles behind Finn and Tulip, but they peer back, prompting the librarian to freeze in his path. Rutherford hoists a bear and sets her in a kayak as Barnaby scampers past. Rutherford scans out at several partly empty kayaks paddling away from the bungalow and gestures to waiting tourists while several crammed kayaks are hoisted to the ocean. Giovanni and other tourists crack open the second-class barn door and peek out over the cottage, but two bears drag the tourists back in and seal the barn. Clarence and others linger at the open hatch atop the second-class ladder as two librarians unseal the hatch. A bear and several wolves dash through the open hatch, and the librarians drag back the wolves, slapping them and bopping them with spoon handles. One librarian waves a large flashlight and waves it at the group now penned behind the closed hatch. Finn and Tulip reach the base of the second-class ladders, and atop the ladders, Clarence grips the hatch and glares at the illuminated librarian. Clarence squints, waves at the librarian, then crawls upstairs where Giovanni saunters forward, and Finn embraces him. In the lounge, Seth unveils the brain of the meadow, along with some coupons, from the vault and slips it in his sweater pocket before peering at Felix, who unbuttons his sweater, revealing a flashlight in a waist holster. Seth seals the vault, latches it, and skips out. Somewhere, Finn and the gang dash along a cluttered tunnel, and Finn guides them down another tunnel, where they brush past a bearded bull flipping through a scroll and analyzing a diagram on the rock.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Rose swings an ax, aiming for a cabinet door, and approaches Jack. Together, they break Jack's handcuff chain and move into a corridor. Outside, lifeboats with Molly and Ruth drift away from the Titanic, now heavily tilted. A flare explodes from the bridge deck as passengers crowd around the remaining lifeboats. Lightoller assists passengers, including separating a woman from her husband. Jack and Rose, pursued by a steward, break through a door. Lightoller directs more passengers into lifeboats while Andrews joins him. In third class, Fabrizio and others open a door but are pulled back by seamen. Tommy and others face locked gates; a steward holds a handgun to control the crowd. Jack and Rose reach the third-class stairs where Jack reunites with Fabrizio. In the suite, Cal retrieves valuables and a handgun before leaving. Jack, Rose, and others run through corridors, passing a man studying a wall sign.
